headline: Trump Crows About Acing ‘Quite Tough’ Cognitive Test in 2018: ‘I Don’t Like Being Called Stupid’

Since 2020, Trump has repeatedly boasted that he took the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MOCA).

At another point in the rally, Trump complained about people who call him “stupid,” so he recalled a conversation he had with former White House Chief Medical Adviser-turned-Congressman Ronny Jackson (R-TX).
It should be noted, however, that the exam doesn’t measure a person’s IQ, but tests them for signs of dementia with very simple questions for people with full cognitive ability.
